Thanks for your help. I have found a workaround for now. (I’ll leave details in this thread in case anyone else encounters this.)

In case anyone else encounters this:
*Trigger:* applied update to theme from marketplace
*Setup:* Live site built on child theme of marketplace theme
*What broke:* All the theme child theme colors, fonts, etc (all the things decided in the fields.json file), the css. Custom header and child css was not affected.
*My bandaid fix:* 
• Cloned down the main.css and the _variables.css files. Linked them directly into the child theme base.html file. Layout, structure etc returned. Selections from fields.json did not.
• Set the main theme to match the child theme selections. Luckily this portal only has one site and one theme. Pushed these to all assets, but still did not affect the live site. I also changed a setting in the child theme and published, and that did not affect the live site either.
• Opened and republished each individual cms website page and landing pages (250 altogether) from the content editor. The intended edits were showing up in the content editor. 
Now my site looks like it should, but the underlying problem isn’t fixed. My humble opinion, something went off in a backend part of HS, so that it wasn’t inheriting all the parts of the child theme after the update to the original. The child theme is not available in the template selection menu, but is listed in the Theme section of website settings.

I updated several websites today all using the same marketplace main theme with custom child themes. This site was the only one that went off the rails.
